Personal Assistant to the Managing Director Job at Ascentech Services Limited




        
    

        
        Ascentech Services Limited is the most sought-after Human Resource Solution Provider with its Head Office in Lagos, Nigeria. We have a reputation for satisfying and surpassing clients' expectations through our core offerings: Recruitment and Selection, Outsourcing, Training and Development. To accomplish these, we leverage creating and managing change in organisations by improving efficiency through our proven and dynamic HR solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Personal Assistant to the Managing Director

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Manage MD’s schedule, meetings, and correspondence
	Prepare reports, presentations, and documents
	Coordinate travel arrangements and handle confidential tasks.


Requirements


	HND/BSc in any relevant field
	Minimum of 2–3 years of relevant experience
	Strong communication, organization, and discretion.


Salary
N350,000 monthly gross (depending on experience).

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: esther@ascentech.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: For more inquiries, message 07074786598.

Description


	The Executive Assistant (EA) will provide high-level administrative support to the Directors, ensuring smooth day-to-day operations, effective communication, and efficient management of schedules, meetings, and projects.
	This role requires exceptional organizational skills, discretion,&nbsp;ability to handle multiple priorities and anticipate needs in a fast-paced environment.


Key Responsibilities

	Provide day-to-day administrative and secretarial support to the Directors.
	Manage Directors&rsquo; calendars, appointments, meetings, and travel arrangements.
	Screen, prioritize, and manage incoming calls, emails, and correspondence.
	Prepare, review, and edit documents, reports, presentations, and meeting materials.
	Take accurate minutes during board and management meetings and ensure timely circulation.

	Act as a key liaison between the Directors and internal departments, clients, and external stakeholders.
	Coordinate meetings, workshops, and events involving the Directors.
	Follow up on action points, deadlines, and decisions made by the Directors.
	Ensure smooth communication flow between management and staff.

	Handle sensitive and confidential information with the highest level of discretion.
	Maintain organized and secure filing systems for documents, contracts, and records.
	Support compliance with internal policies, procedures, and corporate governance standards.

	Assist in tracking projects, initiatives, and performance updates for the Directors.

	Conduct basic research and compile information as required.
	Anticipate Directors&rsquo; needs and proactively resolve administrative challenges.

	Minimum of 3&ndash;5 years of experience as an Executive Assistant or Personal Assistant to senior executives.
	Experience supporting multiple executives or directors is an added advantage.

	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Executive Assistant to the Directors Job at Jott Industries Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        Jott Industries Nigeria Limited is a leading branding and printing company catering to the offline advertising needs of reputable brands through the production of print advertising and promotional materials for over 30 years.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Assistant to the Directors

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Description
     

            
    




	The Executive Assistant (EA) will provide high-level administrative support to the Directors, ensuring smooth day-to-day operations, effective communication, and efficient management of schedules, meetings, and projects.
	This role requires exceptional organizational skills, discretion, ability to handle multiple priorities and anticipate needs in a fast-paced environment.


Key Responsibilities
Executive & Administrative Support:


	Provide day-to-day administrative and secretarial support to the Directors.
	Manage Directors’ calendars, appointments, meetings, and travel arrangements.
	Screen, prioritize, and manage incoming calls, emails, and correspondence.
	Prepare, review, and edit documents, reports, presentations, and meeting materials.
	Take accurate minutes during board and management meetings and ensure timely circulation.


Coordination & Communication:


	Act as a key liaison between the Directors and internal departments, clients, and external stakeholders.
	Coordinate meetings, workshops, and events involving the Directors.
	Follow up on action points, deadlines, and decisions made by the Directors.
	Ensure smooth communication flow between management and staff.


Confidentiality & Compliance:


	Handle sensitive and confidential information with the highest level of discretion.
	Maintain organized and secure filing systems for documents, contracts, and records.
	Support compliance with internal policies, procedures, and corporate governance standards.


Operational & Strategic Support:


	Assist in tracking projects, initiatives, and performance updates for the Directors.
	Support preparation of strategic documents, proposals, and business plans.
	Conduct basic research and compile information as required.
	Anticipate Directors’ needs and proactively resolve administrative challenges.


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Management, Secretarial Studies, or a related field.
	Minimum of 3–5 years of experience as an Executive Assistant or Personal Assistant to senior executives.
	Experience supporting multiple executives or directors is an added advantage.


Skills & Competencies:


	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	Strong organizational, time-management, and multitasking abilities.
	High level of professionalism, integrity, and confidentiality.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
	Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
	Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills.
	Ability to perform well under pressure and meet tight deadlines.


Personal Attributes:


	Proactive and highly dependable.
	Discreet and trustworthy.
	Well-presented with strong interpersonal skills.
	Flexible and adaptable in a dynamic work environment.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@jottltd.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

  "description": "Global Oneword Healthcare Limited is a pharmaceutical company specialized in importation and distribution of medicines.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative Assistant
Job Location:&nbsp;Surulere, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a smart, reliable, and proactive Administrative Assistant to support daily office operations, handle administrative tasks, assist with content creation and advertising, and support logistics-related activities.


Key Responsibilities


	Handle general administrative and office support duties.
	Support advertising and promotional activities (online and offline)
	Create basic content for business promotion.
	Manage records, documents, and basic reporting
	Provide support for daily operational tasks as assigned


Requirements


	HND or B.Sc qualification in any related field
	Experience in a logistics company or shipment booking is an added advantage
	Must be computer literate (Microsoft Office, internet tools, basic content creation, graphic designing, powerpoint)
	Good knowledge of advertising and promotions
	Must reside within the Surulere, Amuwo Odofin, Mile 2, Coker Orile axis
	Presentable, hardworking, loyal, and respectful
